title: Switch 2's mysterious 'C' button finally confirmed
description: Of all the mysteries still surrounding Switch 2, its rumoured 'C' button is perhaps the most enigmatic. Not least because when Nintendo finally revealed its Switch successor earlier this year, there was a conspicuously blank square where everyone was expecting a 'C' button to be. Now, though, with Switch 2's full reveal just a week away, the 'C' has finally, quietly been confirmed in an official image for the newly announced Nintendo Today mobile app. Read more
author: Matt Wales

title: Uncovering The Mysteries of Atomfall
description: Britain in the â€˜60s was a weird place. The Beatles had conquered the world and Sean Conneryâ€™s Bond redefined the modern gentleman; from the outside looking in, the influential isle was the height of cool. Yet peel back the surface, and youâ€™d discover an altogether stranger Britain bubbling beneath its glitzy exterior. Itâ€™s a mood perfectly captured in Rebellionâ€™s Atomfall, a post-apocalyptic action survival epic that fully embraces the scary â€˜60s and leans into Britannia at its most eerie.

title: How To Get A Job In InZoi
description: What is the single thing that we all spend the biggest portion of our waking hours doing? Our jobs, of course. It's what I'm doing right now as I write this article, even. No life sim would be complete with jobs--and so obviously InZoi gives players the chance to go to work and get their daily grind on. Here's how to get a job in Krafton's new Sims competitor.Table of Contents [hide]How to get a job in InZoiHow to get a job in InZoiAs with The Sims 4, there are two main types of jobs to choose from: those which send you to a "rabbit hole," in which you're simply offscreen at a workplace that's not on the map, and those where you have to actively control your Zoi as they go about their day at the office. Most jobs are of the rabbit hole type, but each of the available cities also includes two unique active jobs that you can choose from as well.To get a job, you'll need to click on the careers button at the bottom of your Zoi's phone screen, where you can see all the options. In Dowon, the two active jobs are at the fire department, or at Adam Entertainment, an idol management company--all the other available career jobs, which have a little briefcase mark on their icons, are the rabbit hole type of jobs. There are also part-time jobs, too, but you will never be promoted or get a raise at those jobs.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Sea of Thieves crossing over with Destiny doesn't make a lick of sense, but here it is anyway
description: Everything is IP, all of the time, everywhere you look now, because big wigs in suits have got it in their heads that original, uniquely appealing content just can't win over a combination of pixels that resemble something someone already likes. Sea of Thieves is no stranger to crossovers, with big, thematically relevant ones like Monkey Island and Pirates of the Caribbean, as well as some smaller ones like Halo and Banjo Kazooie. Today's crossover is one of the smaller ones, this time with, uhâ€¦ Destiny. The sci-fi, first-person shooter. Huh. Read more
author: Oisin Kuhnke

title: Tencent hand Ubisoft a big wad of cash to spin out Assassin's Creed, Far Cry, and Rainbow Six as a separate business
description: Well, there you have it folks. After months of uncertainty over share price falls, major game delays and squabbles with investors, Ubisoft have opened up a new subsidiary to look after their biggest-selling Assassin's Creed, Rainbow Six, and Far Cry games, with Tencent chucking in a whopping â‚¬1.16 billion - meaning that the latter will have a 25% stake in the new spin-off business when all is said and done. title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 872
description: Soâ€¦what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isnâ€™t, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. Itâ€™s just a list of more or less random questions Iâ€™ve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. Which is the hardest to do: engage in small talk with strangers, ask for directions, paint your toe nails or cook a meal without a recipe? For the life of me, I canâ€™t make most meals without having a recipe to follow. Iâ€™m not one of those people who can cook from the heart and throw ingredients together with abandon. I need precise measurements (because one personâ€™s pinch of salt might mean something completely different to someone else) and guidelines, otherwise Iâ€™ll short circuit. 2. Do you wanna go dancing at the pink pony club? Sure, why not? Iâ€™m gonna keep on daaaaaan-cingâ€¦ 3. What language would you like to be fluent in: French, Cantonese, Arabic or sign language? All of them. LOL! title: Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 855
description: Yup, the boss lady wants us to tighten our belts around here. It looks like the economy is slowing down a bit, so no more Tuesday all-you-can-eat turkey or free five-egg omelets in the cafeteria. She wants everyone in the company to cut back, and that includes Rosie and Marnie. Starting immediately, there will be no more kibble showers! The leadership committee is hard at work identifying opportunities for process improvementâ€¦ Rosie and CHO (Chief Hugging Officer) Whiskers are upping the napping quota by a staggering 15%! That means more hugs for everyone! Or else!!! Itâ€™s gonna be rough for a while. Hopefully things turn around soon. I have faith in Rosieâ€™s leadership ability. And where many leaders lack empathy, she really goes out of her way to show she cares about people. Itâ€™s very motivating! Marnie is totally fired up about it. I sure wish Tabs were still around because he was so good at business. He would have known how to navigate a downturn better than anyone. ðŸ˜Š Your friendly neighborhood beauty addict,[Continue reading...] The post Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 855 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
